repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This function is used only in the `workspace/configuration` handler,
and does not warrant a public API because of its confusing return types.

Related:
- #25272 
- #25400 
- #27015 

Apparently, it's barely used as a public API: https://github.com/search?q=vim.lsp.util.lookup_section+language%3ALua&type=code

comment_data.body: I think we need to use `vim.deprecate` now too.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,6 +2140,7 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string The value of settings accessed via section
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)

comment_data.body: Yes, I just checked #26742 #26755 and MAINTAIN.md. Thanks
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,6 +2140,7 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string The value of settings accessed via section
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)

comment_data.body:
Any reason this deprecation needs to be fast-tracked instead of deprecating in `0.12`?

The other fast-tracked deprecations had explicit justifications: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/26742#issuecomment-1870032292
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

comment_data.body: I see. I don't see any particular reason, but was simply following other functions removed from `vim.lsp.util`. We should follow the standard deprecation strategy, let me fix it to 0.12.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

comment_data.body: `vim.deprecate` no longer gives a warning on the first version bump so we can add it immediately. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/26735
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

comment_data.body:
> `vim.deprecate` no longer gives a warning on the first version bump so we can add it immediately. #26735

Understood, my point was about using `'0.12'` instead of `'0.11'` as the final argument, not about removing the call entirely.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

comment_data.body:
There is a small bug from #26735 `vim.deprecate` actually doesn't give a warning, another fixup is coming ðŸš—

--> #27027
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

@@ -2140,7 +2140,9 @@ end
 ---@param settings table language server settings
 ---@param section  string indicating the field of the settings table
 ---@return table|string|vim.NIL The value of settings accessed via section. `vim.NIL` if not found.
+---@deprecated
 function M.lookup_section(settings, section)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.lsp.util.lookup_section()', 'vim.tbl_get()', '0.11')

comment_regular_data.body:
Q: Should I add `vim.deprecate` call()?

I can also fix the `workspace/configuration` handler to use `vim.tbl_get` (0.7.0+). (Need to ensure and test if the behavior is exactly the same, though)

> Q: Should I add `vim.deprecate` call()?

I [think so](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/965dbd0e019ab2e2d7db1af57f406d7cf57716d7/MAINTAIN.md#deprecating-and-removing-features).

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(lsp): deprecate `vim.lsp.util.lookup_section`
